adjectives.description: mortalist (comparative more mortalist, superlative most mortalist)

entries.meaning: (now chiefly historical) Pertaining to this doctrine of mortalism. [from 18th c.]
examples: Both Anabaptists and Familists sympathised with the ‘mortalist’ doctrine that the soul slept until the Day of Judgement  […]

entries.meaning: (now chiefly historical) Someone who believes that the soul is mortal like the body. [from 17th c.]
